A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, various sorts of turmoil in her Dallastown, Pennsylvania, family life are brought to light, and capped by tragedy. Pretty much an exercise in cliche, but so beautifully shot you may forgive the Hollywood drivel.

I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of the competition between the kids, and the family tradition and background they shared; then in the second hour, it gives off a sense of separation between the characters.
What other movies have you used soundtrack scores to give off meaning?

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence through the evil schemes of the local agriculture cooperative and the ideological struggle between cities and rural areas.
